concept.title: Case 8: Policy based on VoLTE application

section.title: Overview
section.p: This use case demonstrates the ability of NCC to support VoLTE calls. PCRF role for VoLTE is based on Diameter AF procedures and integrating with IMS.

ul.li: Defines QoS and prioritization for a default bearer for IMS signaling over a dedicated APN.
Performs Rx to Gx message translation in creating a dedicated bearer for the purpose of the call, providing QoS, prioritization as well as charging information to PGW.

li.p: Simulate attachment for a device on VoLTE APN:
If Called-Station-Id = ims, then verify that NCC returns QCI = 5, ARP Priority = 2, Pre-emption-capability = DISABLED, Pre-emption-vulnerability = DISABLED.

ul.li: Simulate an Rx AAR with one Media-Component-Description with Media-Type = audio.
Verify the NCC generates Gx RAR towards the PGW to install a dynamic PCC rule for audio (also replies over Rx with AAA with SUCCESS).
Simulate an Rx STR for the same AF session ID.
Verify that NCC generates Gx RAR towards the PGW to remove the dynamic PCC rule for audio (also replies over Rx with STA with SUCCESS).

note.p: Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.

ol.li: NCC provides support for VoLTE. The Rx to Gx is done by code together with couple of default rule groups provided by NCC. The QoS for the VoLTE default bearer can be defined in rules.
Log in to the SM GUI and navigate to Subscriber Manager and select Devices tab. Click to create a device.

Create a rule group for IMS as shown in the following figure. To do this, log in to SM GUI and navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Policy tab, and select Rules And Variables from the drop-down list. Click to create a rule group.
